results.title: CARDIAC ASSESSMENTS AND IMPLANTABLE LOOP RECORDER PLACEMENT IN THREE MALE GELADAS (THEROPITHECUS GELADA).
results.text_hl: One male had an elevated cTnI level (210 ng/L), reduced ejection fraction (46%), and multiple episodes of @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Supraventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D013617 @@@supraventricular tachycardia@@@ and non-sustained @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@.

citations.NLM: Zec SH, Miller M, Hollinger C, Croft L, Goldman M, D'Andrea K, Moody JE, McCann C, Bartlett SL. CARDIAC ASSESSMENTS AND IMPLANTABLE LOOP RECORDER PLACEMENT IN THREE MALE GELADAS (THEROPITHECUS GELADA). J Zoo Wildl Med. 2025 Mar;56(1):175-183. PMID: 40067238
citations.BibTeX: @article{40067238, title={CARDIAC ASSESSMENTS AND IMPLANTABLE LOOP RECORDER PLACEMENT IN THREE MALE GELADAS (THEROPITHECUS GELADA).}, author={Zec SH and Miller M and Hollinger C and Croft L and Goldman M and D'Andrea K and Moody JE and McCann C and Bartlett SL}, journal={J Zoo Wildl Med}, volume={56}, number={1}, pages={175-183}}

results.title: Comparison of lisinopril versus digoxin for congestive heart failure during maintenance diuretic therapy. The Lisinopril-Digoxin Study Group.
results.text_hl: There was no difference between @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Digoxin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004077 @@@digoxin@@@ with regard to their effects on the frequency of @DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular ectopic@@@ counts, couplets, or nonsustained @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@.

citations.NLM: Herlitz J. Comparison of lisinopril versus digoxin for congestive heart failure during maintenance diuretic therapy. The Lisinopril-Digoxin Study Group. Am J Cardiol. 1992 Oct 8;70(10):84C-90C. PMID: 1329479
citations.BibTeX: @article{1329479, title={Comparison of lisinopril versus digoxin for congestive heart failure during maintenance diuretic therapy. The Lisinopril-Digoxin Study Group.}, author={Herlitz J}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={70}, number={10}, pages={84C-90C}}

results.title: Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs?
results.text_hl: The incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@VT@@@) on @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and reperfusion was significantly reduced by @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Birincioglu M, Aksoy T, Olmez E, Acet A. Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs? Free Radic Res. 1997 Oct;27(4):389-96. PMID: 9416467
citations.BibTeX: @article{9416467, title={Protective effect of ACE inhibitors on ischemia-reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in rats: is this effect related to the free radical scavenging action of these drugs?}, author={Birincioglu M and Aksoy T and Olmez E and Acet A}, journal={Free Radic Res}, volume={27}, number={4}, pages={389-96}}

results.title: Potential beneficial as well as detrimental effects of chronic treatment with lisinopril and (or) spironolactone on isolated hearts following low-flow ischemia in normal and infarcted rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ also decreased @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ and action-potential duration dispersion concomitantly with increased reactive @DISEASE_Hyperemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006940 @@@hyperemia@@@ and better contractile recovery.

citations.NLM: Rochetaing A, Chapon C, Marescaux L, Le Bouil A, Furber A, Kreher P. Potential beneficial as well as detrimental effects of chronic treatment with lisinopril and (or) spironolactone on isolated hearts following low-flow ischemia in normal and infarcted rats. Can J Physiol Pharmacol. 2003 Sep;81(9):864-72. PMID: 14614522
